titles.title: Roth-Wallop-Pressler Small Business Investment and Growth Act
Small Business Investment and Growth Act
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to limit the tax rate for certain small businesses, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S4473-4474)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 4/19/1994--Introduced. Small Business Investment and Growth Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to establish a maximum small business tax rate on taxable small business income for individuals, partnerships, or certain S corporations. Describes such income as the least of: (1) income from the active conduct of a trade or business in which the taxpayer is a material participant; (2) net earnings from self-employment; or (3) the taxpayer's share of additions to a qualified retained earnings account of such trade or business. Allows distributions from such account to pay ordinary and necessary business expenses or to pay the tax imposed by this Act. Excludes from employment taxes the portion of taxable small business income in excess of $135,000.
